result.execSummary:
The defendant Orion H. S. Verbist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:24 p.m. Defendant Orion H. S. Verbist in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Information - Bayne-Allison in receipt-waive further reading-enters not guilty plea. Plea questionaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Bayne-Allison/Court statement on sentencing. Bednar-Clemens now in court for ADA Michlig. Defendant questions Court regarding probation transfer to Forest County - Court informs defendant that he should report to Oneida County and ask for transfer. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Jail - 60 days with Huber for all purposes to commence on/before January 24, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs/fees.
Appeal rights given
Notice of Ineligible Voting Rights and Acknowledgment provided. 
Adj. 4:43 p.m.

3:26 p.m. Defendant Orion H. S. Verbist in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bayne-Allison files written Waiver of Preliminary Examination. -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bayne-Allison states offer has been made - resolution is close - requests arraignment/pretrial conference date. Bail continued. Adj. 3:31 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:34 p.m. Defendant Orion H. S. Verbist in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
NO entry upon any Dominos Pizza. SUBMIT TO BOOKING.

2:25 P.M. Defendant Orion H. S. Verbist in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
